author: {'steamid': '76561198254156580', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1529092742}
review:
Ok, so I was going to play this game then I read the privacy policy and I would like to quote a few pieces that I think speak for themselves - 
1 - "The Services may from time to time read the User's device to determine what other apps
have been installed and information, such as the User's city and gender, may be inferred
based on the identity of those apps."
        For comparison here is the definition of spyware - "software that enables a user to obtain covert information about another's computer activities by transmitting data covertly from their hard drive."

2 - "Holyday Studios may partner with third party Service Providers to provide access to existing
payment gateways. The User's credit card, banking and other billing information is kept with 
payment processors and other service providers where the User can read more about their privacy
policies"

3 - "Holyday Studios may also sell, rent or share the User's usage data and other Non-Personal Data
with third parties"

4 - "Holyday Studios may transfer information that Holyday Studios collects about the User to affiliated
entities, or to other third parties across borders and from the User's country or jurisdiction to other
countries or jurisdictions around the world. These countries and jurisdictions may not have the
same data protection laws as the User's own jurisdiction, and the User consents to the transfer of
information over international borders and the use and disclosure of information about the User,
including Personal Data, as described in this Privacy Policy."

Then it ends but for the above, I would like to quote the UK data protection act (1998) - 
"8. Personal data shall not be transferred to a country or territory outside the
European Economic Area unless that country or territory ensures an adequate
level of protection for the rights and freedoms of data subjects in relation to the
processing of personal data."

Also an additional quote from the GDPR -
GDPR - "Personal data should only be processed where it isn’t reasonably feasible to carry out the processing in another manner. Where possible, it is preferable to use anonymous data. Where personal data is needed, it should be adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary for the purpose (‘data minimisation’). It’s your company/organisation's responsibility as controller to assess how much data is needed and ensure that irrelevant data isn’t collected."

You could argue a lot of the information they collect is unnecessary to hold such as "User's name, email address, date of
birth, gender and/or phone number" 


The question you have to ask is "Does this game violate data protection laws?".
Anyway I would not recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198299728275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1691076067}
review: Holyday City is a game that offers different activities to have fun. It's mostly idle, but you can also get the chance to build production-making factories to spend on upgrades and free business. Also, it offers a prestige system that lets you keep the bonuses that you earn. There is a store page, but its easy enough to save up gold bars which are given each day, plus a chance to earn more if you goto their facebook page. I enjoy playing Holyday City Because it has so much to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984051565', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 7679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7379, 'last_played': 1545311400}
review:
One of the best Idle Clicker games I have played. Well balanced in Time vs Progress.  Graphics are well done. as well as game play.  This is NOT a P2W (Pay 2 Win) game, though you could buy some upgrades to advance a bit faster. There is a Daily Twitter word, that awards you with a random consumable.

Overall, this is one of the best Idle Clickers on Steam.  I highly recommend this Holyday City: Reloaded.
10/10

review: For a free game, it's a great way to pass the time. It definitely does take awhile to build up funds though and it's one of those games where you have to wait for hours and sometimes days to be able to unlock certain areas. But, it keeps collecting funds when you've exited the game so you can come back to it the day after and have progressed further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006025789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 29936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14032, 'last_played': 1531144290}
review:
I'm addicted to clicker/idle games as a passive way to break from the day and de-stress. I've tried them all.

Holyday City is definitely one of my favorites as it doesn't feel like a simple clone of most other clickers out there. There's constant events and new facilities to constantly level up to and unlock that add in more 'mini games' of sorts.

The in game currency is gainable without paying if you so wish.... they are very generous with the daily log in rewards and daily Twitter codes you can enter to recieve more perks.

All in all... if you're into Idle games, this is definitely worth a download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025034874', 'num_games_owned': 5321, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 18030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18030, 'last_played': 1527191681}
review:
The good:
Decent, but not great clicker mechanics.  Progression is slow, but tangible.  Restarts (necessary for multipliers) are painless.
Surprisingly good events.  They are actually much more fair than the events that certain other clicker games run (I'm looking at you, AdVenture Capitalist.)
Low impact program.  The game doesn't take a lot of resources and cheerfully runs in the background without interfering with other, more demanding games.  There are a few idle games on Steam that are terrible in this department.

The bad:
HIDEOUS art style.  This games looks like a straw man argument about "why mobile ports are fugly."  
The most recent update wanted to install spyware to track players "in-game behavior."  I real the EULA that popped up and said lolnope.jpg   

Conclusion:
I uninstalled.  This game is a flawed gem, without the "gem" part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009802063', 'num_games_owned': 2871, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 19404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4484, 'last_played': 1580611576}
review:
Argh, this game. It's an idle game, and it's colourful and the UI is fairly clear.

However, the pace seems a little unbalanced and the game has no spark to its writing, or its world. It's super bland. It's not even funny.

Also - too much is gated for the first few days you play. There are loads of elements on the UI that are just "you need to be X level, come back later", which just feels a bit like an "under construction" sign.

Some idle games are addictive to the point of obsession.

This one's like a scab you can't help poking, even though all it does it stop you from healing faster. All I feel I am doing is making things worse for myself.

However, it's still in development. Maybe in time it'll improve.

review:
Le grind est réel !

Un jeu qui mettra à mal votre patience si vous jouez en F2P.
Comme tout bon IDLE/Clicker qui se respecte, la progression est plutôt lente - ce jeu ne déroge pas à la règle sauf si bien évidemment vous souhaitez passer par la case "achat in-game".

Plutôt basique dans le principe, quelques bonnes idées sont ici à mettre au crédit des dév' qui rendent le jeu appréciable.

review: having finished Adventure Captialist over a year ago, and not really liking Adventure Communist, i was thrilled to recently discover this game. it has all of the features that i loved in AdCap, but presented in a much more refined manner. you can tell the devs studied AdCap, learned from its flaws, and then made a better, more balanced, more fun, much more feature-rich version. if you enjoyed AdCap. you should love Holyday City Reloaded.

review:
Really Nice Game. 

After finishing Adventure Capitalist, i searched exactly for such a type of game.
For me personally Holyday City Reloaded is a upgraded, better version of this clicker game genre. 
I feel the progress everytime i log in, also the rewards are really fair.
A big plus, there is NO pay to win, everything can be unlocked by gaming and daily logins.

Would rate 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198123095278', 'num_games_owned': 3120, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 15141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14832, 'last_played': 1526196301}
review:
[h1]★★★★★★☆☆☆☆

Kostenlos / Free[/h1]

Schon nach den ersten Minuten fiel mir eine Ähnlichkeit, vom Spielprinzip, mit [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/557400/Midas_Gold_Plus/]Midas[/url] [/b]auf. Ein anderer [b]Clicker[/b], welchen ich auch noch schlecht bewertet habe. Und es ist auch vom gleichen Entwickler. Nur dass dieser Clicker hier mich 10x länger hielt während der andere mich nicht mal unterhielt. 👍

Es werden (wieder) Gebäude aufgewertet, per (Sammel-)Klick, irgendwann sind die Gebäudekosten so hoch dass es zu lange dauert das Geld dafür zu generieren, dann resetted man den Spaß wieder und erhält einen oder mehrere Boni die den Geldauswurf erhöhen... und es fängt wieder von vorne an.
[b]Das ist das endlose Spielprinzip[/b].
Viel klicken ist auch nicht 👍; gut für die Hand. =)

Beschleunigt wird die Geldmaschine durch Upgrades über die [b]Premiumwährung[/b]. Diese erhält man nicht nur durch Echtgeld sondern auch über den gestaffelten [b]Täglichen-Einlog-Bonus[/b] und [b]Eventspiele [/b](dort dann als Zufallsbelohnung). Spielt man jeden Tag kommt man, anders als bei Midas, gut voran. 👍
Persönlich mag ich gestaffelte Einlogboni nicht, das entspricht nicht meiner Casualgamingnatur. Mich jeden Tag einloggen zu müssen um ja nicht den max. Bonus, der verdammt gut ist, zu verlieren... bei einem Clicker... ist ein Anfang vom Ende. 👎 Auf lange Sicht würde es mich nerven. Dieser selbstauferlegte Pseudozwang. ;)

Damit die Langeweile nicht so schnell Einzug erhält, gibt es diverse Dinge zu tun als Beschäftigung: den Hafen aufwerten, Missionen um die Marina zu füllen, das Aquarium leveln, Gebäudeprofitsteigerungen durch Eventspiele u.v.m. Alles nur um die Geldscheffellei zu erhöhen damit man weiter kommt bis zum nächsten Reset. Allerdings werden diese Orte erst [b]nach und nach freigeschalten[/b], je nach Stadtlevel.

[b]Der Anfang ist deswegen zäh und langsam.[/b]

Die moderne [b]klickibunti Oberfläche[/b] mit ihren Riesenbuttons lässt vermuten, dass es das Spiel auch für mobile Geräte gibt, aber dem scheint leider nicht zu sein. Ich fand es nirgends und bekam auch nie eine Antwort im Forum auf diese Frage. 👎 Das Spiel wäre aber ideal für's Handy, am besten noch mit Accountsynchronisation in Steam - wie [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/329110/Gems_of_War__Puzzle_RPG/]Gems of War[/url] es vormacht.

Die [b]Erfolge [/b]schalten sich von alleine frei. Allerdings muss man auch weit/lange spielen. Ich bin aktuell auf Level 29, habe 34 von 42 Erfolgen aber höre jetzt auch auf mit dem Spiel. Keine Lust mehr mich da jeden Tag einloggen zu "müssen" ^^
Der Weg bis dahin war aber überwiegend unterhaltend.
Btw mein Lieblingsklicker ist [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/402840/Crusaders_of_the_Lost_Idols/]Crusaders of the Lost Idols[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198157272286', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 15409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12231, 'last_played': 1569880105}
review:
O jogo é divertido para quem tem paciência, pois o tempo que você passa pra desbloquear coisas é muito longo e pode te deixar até mesmo enjoado, demorando pra evoluir. Não tem muito o que fazer no jogo, você continua evoluindo e evoluindo até desbloquear uma coisa nova, que muitas vezes nem é tão importante assim. Acredito que o jogo poderia ter mais opções, além das disponíveis, para tornar as coisas mais dinâmicas e divertidas (apesar de ter o Holyday Island, você demora muito tempo até chegar lá)
Como a Steam não permite colocar uma análise neutra, coloco aqui a opção que chegou mais próxima da minha experiência.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049703661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 447015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275527, 'last_played': 1572460813}
review:
相比同公司另一款游戏《Midas Gold Plus》，本游戏的策略性更进一步。Agent的随机性使得每个人的策略都不一样；airport的设定使得对游戏机制了解，以及计算能力强的玩家可以更有效地调动资源。而后期holyday island和主游戏的互动，更加考验玩家对游戏机制的理解。各资源的相互关联使得本作中策略的重要性达到了同类游戏的新高度。需要提醒的是，本游戏的精髓是需要几百/上千小时的游戏时间（包括离线挂机）才能体会到的。如果游戏时间只有几十小时，更具体地说，Airport开放之前，可能很难体会到其精妙之处。所以，推荐给喜欢计算，并且愿意在一段时间中时不时琢磨一下游戏的玩家。如果对收费和挂机有所疑虑，以我的经验，免费玩家完全可以玩到大后期，而且离线挂机的损失也不是很大，所以不用担心。

由于本游戏的中文资料极少，因此在此附上我的简要心得，给玩过游戏之后有疑问的玩家作参考。

游戏机制：
1.游戏有5种service，5种production。除了极早期，通过数量增加产量的关键节点都在trophies里可以看到，一般是整50、100、200。除了直接产出现金外，service数量增加会增加happiness，而happiness等同于service的产量倍数。5种production，每个都会有各自的资源产出。materials通过增加service的数量，间接增加service产出；energy可以直接让service产出翻几倍；food可以让资源产出翻倍；iron在port,以及中期以后tech在lab的每一次升级都相当于现金产量*1.25；而前期tech在lab可以让产出加速。
2.每一轮游戏的大目标就是在银行存钱（银行会存下现金与货币化资源之和的1/10），然后重新开始，在office中购买manager，推进下一轮游戏进程（如果购买manager所得不足以弥补下一轮前期的产量，可以多攒一点钱多买几个manager，一般买1个，有时买2-3个）,不重新开始的话你会很快发现游戏推不动。
3.在port开放之后，很多玩家对卖资源拿现金的机制不是很理解。其实本游戏的现金和资源类似现实中货币与黄金的关系。举个例子，假如钞票只能换黄金，一秒能生产1克黄金，货币增加100元，则黄金和货币兑换的比例就是100元/克；如果货币增加到1000元/秒，则兑换比例就是1000元/克；反之如果黄金产量增加到10克/秒，则兑换比例就是10元/克。所以当资源产量增加后，看到port能兑换的钱变少了不用奇怪，因为你手里已有的资源变得不那么值钱了。
4.而airport可以把各类资源互相转化。相比port只能单向的用资源换现金，airport可以相对自由地转化资源。同样遵循比例原则，1秒产出的铁等价于1秒产出的食物。此外airport还可以把Tech也转化为可以换钱的前四种资源，五种资源的总产出（在port中换成钱以后）与现金产出的比例为62.5:100。所以airport和port联动之后，资源就可以货币化了。

游戏策略：
1. Holybar前期所得有限，尽量投在直接影响游戏进程的permanent boosters里，resources可以适量投几次，比例不会变；而all profits更优惠的兑换比例会随着购买manager而解锁（先是20换3，之后又30换9等等），所以不要在同一个all profits上投太多（30级前一般最多3次）。后期island开放之后尽快达成60个milestones增加holybar产出，并且优先投在岛上。与主游戏不同，岛上holybar upgrade是随着购买次数而解锁的，一般每一项购买10次左右会出现下一项。Holybar的投资是决定游戏进程最关键的因素，不要浪费在其他方面。
2. 加速道具一时爽，然而从游戏长期来看没有什么用，理论上一直留着，在准备结束这个游戏的时候用掉才最有效率。
3. 如果下一步只有一个明显的选项：买upgrades增加现金产量。则最优策略就是把所有资源通过port卖掉（记得先用airport把energy转化），尽快攒现金买upgrades。City升级和upgrades类似，而且会增加资源产量导致资源贬值，快升级时更应该去卖资源。
4. 然而实际上往往有很多选项。比如还可以直接用资源提升，此时就要计算哪一种可以更快攒现金。如果使用资源，一般来说是先用airport集中资源去升food，但是不要让food上的资源超过升级所需太多，因为一升级food就贬值了（参见游戏机制3和4）。然后再攒一段时间，集中资源去升总体或service的产出。因此，随着资源的积累，每一轮游戏相对来说前期production是主力，主升port和lab；后期service是重点，energy为主，material为辅让重点service提高收益。
5. 了解了资源货币化机制。就可以推断出，如果有意外得到现金产出的机会（比如签订主力agent，或者获得prestiege item），就尽量攒资源；如果有意外得到资源产出的可能，可以视情况先行卖出资源，除了city升级，这种情况不多，但也是有的（比如island里的milestone）。如果已经理解到了这一步，可以说对这个游戏已经比较透彻了。
6. 开了island之后，首要目标是达成60 milestones，之后请把岛上每项资源首先投在影响后续发展且最有效率的地方。比如在花费差不多的情况下，star应该首先投在star gains，其次是all profit和wood gains，然后才是各项资源。wood前期优先投star gains，60 milestones后视效率投wood gains和pearl gains，4级pearl满后优先投wood gains（熬到30级之后，会有奖励的）；满级或者59级以后再投其他的。pearl在star gains满了以后优先投满recreation，单升下半部效率最高。

写完之后，再想想看有些没玩多久的人说这游戏就是干等，以及有些人觉得这游戏太简单。我觉得，是他们以为很简单。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044210529', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1532604056}
review:
Well, it's a clicker idle game and I just want to fill my library with those. This one does its job, but I have few complaints.

First is that the game visually pushes you to buy things a bit too much. Monetization is good, but it feels like playing a mobile phone game. Please keep this kind of content away from steam. Please, developers, keep these big shop buttons less visible, they take 20% of the screen.

Second is the graphics look like outsourced-style vectors. There's no visually creative love put into this game. Disappointed.

But I'll still play it. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993195235', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2177, 'last_played': 1553891460}
review:
"Игре" место там откуда она пришла - на мобильных устройствах.

Одно и тоже - сбрось прогресс получи бонус и так 2-3 раза в день, это не нормально для кликера. Уровень города растет, а точнее не растет. Разница в стоимости между покупкой апгрейдов временами просто неадекватная. Но вы всегда можете задонатить и облегчить себе жизнь.

Мусор которому лучше бы никогда не появляться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010114543', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5629, 'last_played': 1525207865}
review:
It's alright, but it's a little too simple, and there's plenty of other idle games that give you more options and have more ways to interact while you are just waiting.

However the biggest reason that I attribute my thumbs down to this game is the customer service. I have no expectations for a pre-release game to be without bugs, but I expect the customer service to be helpful and responsive, especially when they advertise as such.

I have been unable to put in their daily codes through the steam client (however I can through the browser version) and I emailed support letting them know specific details about my client, my system specifications, the fact that I do not run adblock or have a firewall, and that I have a fully updated Steam client and game files.

Three days later I receive a copy-paste response telling me I need to turn off my adblocker and firewall, and giving me advice as if I was playing the browser version, and pretended I didn't give them any of the aforementioned information.

I respond immediately reiterating what I told them, and FOUR days later I receive virtually the same email. Completely unacceptable. There are better idle games than this and this type of customer service should never be rewarded.

review: It's a lovely little game that sits nicely in the background.  When flicking through Facebook, watching Netflix or even when playing an AAA game, it's just kicking along.   If you need a small, unobtrusive, relaxing casual clicker based type game, you won't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968585365', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1549863228}
review:
It has just enough of the key clicker elements to be kind of addicting, but there are better idle games to spend your time with if you want to. This one has bad art, takes an oddly long time to load and, most importantly, typically takes too long for things to actually progress in any sort of meaningful way, especially if you're not paying money.

But I'll probably keep playing it, because I'm a very broken man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050339033', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1524855619}
review:
It's free, so what can I say?
Maybe if I liked this genre more, or it was on a different platform. Maybe if I played it while waiting to get into the doctor's office or while waiting in line at the DMT. Maybe then it would've been fun.
But there's literally nothing to do. You just... let it run. And wait. Wait for "money". And then click a button to buy more things, and then wait more.
I dunno.
Not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008252444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1524778902}
review:
The Problem with Idle-Games is not the lack of gameplay, the only reason for me personaly, its the feeling of progression.
But this game does not have this. At the beginning its interesting to have upgrades, material, energy, food, iron and research points to upgrade your buildings and get more profit. 

But after playing it for a few days it feels heavily more like a wall instead of a little buff you can adjust.
its the same problem i had with Midas Gold Plus from the same developer.

You waiting for your upgrade and after buying it, you have like a few hours until you realize you are weak again and 
have to wait twice as long. 
I am just at lvl 2 town, but i have to wait nearly a day to reset and have a small permanent upgrade, to progress.
This game gives you now and then x2 or x4 profits buff but you have only progression if you have x10 profit as last time

For me, Clicker Hereos gives me more sense of progression

author: {'steamid': '76561198071760031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1524622912}
review:
1. super super boring after 10 minutes in... but good time waster i guess

2. easy to get started even your brainless jelly-fish mother could play it, but they want money right away to speed things up

3. its about as easy as a game gets. so i guess i recommend it to KIDS who are looking for kid games to play

4. if you cant understand this simple game... then seriously go back and get your G.E.D you highschool drop out

5. i dont recommend even wasting any time in this clicker game if you enjoy clicker games. this one is far below the level of enjoyable. its in the kid clicker zone. not meant for adults who enjoy clicker games. i could name 1 adult clicker game that you would enjoy more. but it isnt this game for sure.... edit: i'm pretty sure you spelt holiday wrong to :( but if you were trying to be religious, there wasnt any religion in this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198240055538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1524630927}
review: This is Super Lame! All you do is watch numbers go up on the screen and left click once and a while to make the numbers move faster. When you exit and come back the numbers have kept growing... so what. Where's the fun, where's the challenge? It's not even a good light clicker game cause you can exit and it'll keep playing for you. Come back again for no reason and pay money for what!?! To make the numbers grow faster??? Go away, look for something else to play. All the positive comments are lies!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992234603', 'num_games_owned': 1798, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1525741252}
review:
So far I've only got about an hour and a half of playtime. I'll update this review if things change, but right now, it's boring af. I click to buy something then wait for 10 or 15 minutes before I can buy something else. Progress is very slow, at least from the start of the game. 

If you're looking for something that's engaging this isn't it. If you want something to run in your 2nd monitor and only care to look at it once every 30 minutes, then this will work for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220519669', 'num_games_owned': 3214, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 13471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3223, 'last_played': 1539811523}
review: Such a boring, repetitive experience. Not even the "special events" amount to more than just clicking a button and waiting. There are planty of other free idle/clicker games on Steam that, at the VERY least, have more creative imagery than this game. The only positive points that comes to mind are the lack of glitches, and that no content is locked behind spending real-world currency.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009138626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1522598035}
review:
What is this even supposed to be?
Should I build one or two burger joints? Nah,  buy them by the hundred. No apparent gameplay. Make quadrillions within 2 hours, but only to unlock a series of pictures of things that generate money. So if unlocking things with zero effort is your thing, maybe give it a try, otherwise perhaps not. Oh, and the trophy room gives you awards all the way up to 9,000 burger houses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968093652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 54627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16514, 'last_played': 1627691100}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982577561', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8351, 'last_played': 1531854231}
review:
It is a nice clicker-game for people who can wait a long time. 
If you just wanna check your progress once a day or several times a month and you enjoy it that your city is growing then you are going to have fun with this game. After a while you explore more and more content.
It´s really basic and simple but the developers publish new updates every now and then that you can play it for months. 
If you are not into clicker than this game is not for you!
From my side 5/5 as a clicker game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164749691', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 420, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1522033083}
review:
[b]Zdecydowanie nie mój typ klikacza :/

Gra oferuje miłą dla oka oprawę graficzną oraz sporą ilość opcji i rzeczy do wykonania, lecz niestety jest to typ clickera, który polega na odpaleniu w tle gry i ona sama sobie gra a nasze klikatnie polega tylko na zwiększaniu przychodów gry.

Kogoś może wciągnąć przyznaje, ale dla mnie to zdecydowanie za mało.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056779554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1521304508}
review:
sort of nice game, meaning it does what it sais, but imo a bit to static.  Only looking at a screen to get cash is boring.
I dont know if i get to view "my city" ever. Im just town lvl 1 still. 
Also ... being online for % income is nice but sort of cheat. As in "keep logged in and play other games at same time".
BUT if you need a rest from those other very demanding games you play, its a relieve to do this one as easy mix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261685733', 'num_games_owned': 2637, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1538294680}
review:
if any of you follow me at all you know i love a good clicker game and this just so happens to be another fun time

i really like the fact that when you start again (like other games have had for years) it seems to give you a direct benefit to your game

from bugers and coffee to mines and labs they are lots to collect and upgrade and it's just a fun time and also make sure to come back everyday to collect daily rewards and build up your empire to greatness

not pay 2 win in anyway never spent a penny and never will - not needed to enjoy the game

lovely game

author: {'steamid': '76561198408112699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5904, 'last_played': 1574523774}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097363639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11645, 'last_played': 1536290073}
review:
An incremental/idle game with loads of features. It's incredibly easy to sink a lot of time into the early game as there is such quick progression and fun unlocks.

Inevitably, the game becomes quite grindy as you begin to work your way towards the endgame. However, the abundance of features and the low maintenance style of the game allows you to continuously come back to keep developing your progress.

review: Это кликер, в котором вам нужно будет развивать свой Город Мечты. Буду честен, кликер довольно медленный и скучноватый, но сделан действительно с душой. Количество всяких кнопочек и фишечек поражает воображение. Есть апгрейды для каждого конкретного бизнеса, они идут по очереди по кругу, и у каждого свое описание, так вот, я прочитал их наверное штук 300 и они даже и не думают заканчиваться. Объема текста хватит на маленькую новеллу. Есть апгрейды под кнопкой "оборудование", там покупаются всякие бонусы за еду, энергию и материалы, которые добываются соответственно с ферм, электростанций и заводов. Под кнопкой "атомная лаборатория" еще больше апгрейдов для всего сразу. Есть порт, в котором можно продать ненужные материалы и который можно улучшать, чтобы продавать еще дороже. Начиная с определенного момента, в порту разблокируются миссии, за которые будут давать жемчуг, жемчуг тратится на предметы, дающие бонусы, а потом открывается аквариум, где за этот жемчуг можно наполнить его новыми вещами... Есть аэропорт, где... Подождите, аэропорт? Я вижу его впервые за 30 часов, лол. В общем там можно поменять одни материалы на другие. Каждые 200 лвлов бизнесов даются трофеи, дающие еще, ЕЩЕ больше бонусов. Ну и наконец, нажав на кнопку "офис", можно сделать сброс игры, получив за это все деньги, полученные с момента последнего сброса и купить менеджеров, дающих еще больше пассивных бонусов. Вам наверное уже надоело читать этот обзор, но я еще не рассказал про ивенты, где можно получить бонусы для денег за час, два , сутки или даже десять суток, ну и конечно, еще предметы и еще бонусы! Ладно. В общем, в кликер действительно вложена душа. Постоянно пилятся какие то апгрейды, от небольших багофиксов, до крупных, когда зачем то перерисовали всех персонажей игры, или вот пару дней назад добавили в дополнение к городу еще и Остров Мечты, где все примерно так же, но на самом деле совершенно по другому. Ну вы поняли. В общем, довольно душевный кликер, в который стоит сыграть, если вы не против мысли заходить в него два раза в день несколько месяцев. Всем удачи!

review: 무난한 idle 게임 clicker 요소는 없다.돈을 벌면 레벨이 오르고 레벨이 오르면 수익 배수가 오르며 특정 레벨이 될때마다 컨텐츠가 하나씩 개방된다

author: {'steamid': '76561198086587789', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1519163764}
review:
A missão é clara, fazer dinheiro! Clicando e melhorando, novos empreendimentos são liberados um por vez. Á medida que pesquisas são concluidas o desenvolvimento da cidade é evidente. Também é possivel upar a cidade, permitindo que nossos negócios cresçam cada vez mais. Os resets tornam o jogo dinámico, fazendo a evolução dos edificios ser mais veloz e lucrativa a cada clique.
Pessoalmente, acredito que o jogo poderia ter mais edificios e não senti que os resets fizessem tanto efeito nas primeiras horas do jogo. O sistema é simples e as imagens de qualidade. Tem potencial para melhorar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993517058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2904, 'last_played': 1521812067}
review:
I love idle games and I swear it's all I have time to play now but to be honest this game is just too scripted to be enjoyable.  You play till specific points decided by them to achieve rewards decided by them and reset when they feel you should reset.   It's an idle game for sure but not even in the top 100 of idle games that I have played here and on Kongregate.   Their version of scripted prestige is just boring.  

Let me explain there is abosutely no choice in this game you  besides picking where to spend holybars that you will get a decent amount overtime and be spammed daily on purchasing.  And in events you can choose between 1 of 2 managers when reaching 400 coins.  That's it the entire game basically plays itself with tiered upgrades that you reach and reset.  There is nothing else I am not even sure this is a game.   

The purchase options are always $8 or higher and while I tend to support most games I put 40+ hours into, remember this is an idle game you have to play it a decent amount to get the true feeling, this game on it's best day is worth a 99cent donation.   Sorry but this just not a good game at all.  If you are interested in Idle games give it a try but don't spend a dime and I guarantee you will be bored quickly.

And to those comparing this to adventure capatilist you are dead wrong this game may look similar but that is where it ends.  AC is a great idle game with interesting this is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022818513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 144962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5428, 'last_played': 1553014725}
review:
Terrible game.  No real clicking, no strategy.  Just let the game run and buy whatever upgrade you can, reset when the game tells you to.  It really should just do all the buying for you and let you watch.  Even worse is the advancement.  Watch that town experience bar quickly fill up until about 95%, then wait a day or more for that final 5%.  Since there's no way to click (in the traditional clicker game sense), you're totally at the mercy of the game when you can finally advance.

From the same people that brought you Midas Gold, a game that hasn't been updated in months.  Don't give them your money, it's obvious they took the money from Midas and used it to make this game instead of actually working on the game the money was intended for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368902998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1518027024}
review: It is a nice and simple, run-of-the-mill idle game. You buy businesses, they give you money, you use that money to buy even more businesses and to improve your town by bringing in managers and investers. There's also a nifty level-up system (at the time of this writing I have a Level 1 town), in which the more money you earn, the more chances you'll have of levelling up. It is honestly a generic idle game that I've seen done a few times, but is still enjoyable nevertheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138342201', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 54094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6556, 'last_played': 1526290001}
review:
Bonjour ici, sachant que Holyday studio lit souvent les évaluations, je vais essayer d'être le plus clair possible.

J'ai jouer 1600 heures à "Midas Gold Plus" leur autre jeu sur steam et malheureusement, le jeu semble prendre exactement la même direction (très frustrante pour moi).

Je m'explique, le jeu est vraiment sympa mais comme sur Midas gold plus à partir d'un certain niveau la seule façon d'avancer c'est d'acheter des multi la seule et unique façon d'avancer c'est ça ici ça semble vraiment recommencé exactement pareil. je trouve ça vraiment frustrant parce que soit tu paies en argent réel pour avancer plus loin (ou tu seras encore bloquer si tes multi ne sont pas assez haut) soit tu attends chaque jour pour récuperer les goldbar gratuit avec le bonus de connexions journaliers. 
C'est tellement ennuyeux comme façon de progresser ! la seule ressource vous permettant de progresser étant celle que vous obtenez avec de l'argent réel. 
Encore une fois votre jeu à un réel potentiel, mais il semble partir comme Midas et vraiment midas quand vous êtes bloqué au même niveau pendant 1 semaine le temps d'avoir des rubis necessaire pour avancer c'est juste de la torture et plus un réel jeu clicker marrant.

Si jamais vous prennez le temps de lire, je place cette évaluation en positive parce que le jeu n'est pas si mal, mais la ou on vous dit que votre jeu avancera en fonction de vos choix, en réalité vous n'avez que très peu de choix à faire et les choix sont dans les différents types de multiplieurs

bon jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198034116281', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 13218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4697, 'last_played': 1542839104}
review:
While this is the better of the two games by the same developer (the other being Midas Gold Plus), it still has a massive wall at the start as it requires you to reach a level 5 city before you can gain access to events, unless of course you pay for early access.

A few weeks in when you finally gain access to the events if you choose not to pay them, the game starts to speed up immensely due to the fact that you can get a decent number of free time skips. At any given point, I'd hovering around 20 IH and 2H skips each. Of course, to balance this the walls slowly creep up, and I've yet to gain access to things like the marina (city level 14) despite event access and my play time.

It's not ideal, but it still feels far more balanced and fair to the player than Midas Gold Plus, which is just a slog and a half to get anything even remotely like progress going. If you know how these games go, well, you could do worse. I vaguely recommend it if you really need a time eater that won't push you to the brink with all its artificial pay walls (but they're still there).

author: {'steamid': '76561198308605439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 9448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5633, 'last_played': 1528478187}
review:
not a bad time waster, click and leave tycoon game.  Aim is to make as much money as possible, while after you get enough to get a new manager unless you have reset protection laptops you will have to start over from the beginning (however as you progress this will not be as tedious as it is in the beginning).

Asides from the clicking to make the money you have mini games in which you can gain items to place permanent increases to such as All companies profits, All Production Profits, All Resources profits etc..... and also a spin game in which you can gain speedups and gold bars which can also boost your profits or place other permanent boosts onto your gains...

Definitely a gain you can play if you do not have a lot of time on your hands and not have the time to watch the $$$ roll in....lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198087549678', 'num_games_owned': 1428, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 77832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6953, 'last_played': 1534382172}
review:
Ótimo jogo Idle.
Descobri pelo Kongregate e, assim que vi que ele estava na Steam, baixei pra começar a jogar de novo. A meta é parar só quando coletar todos os achievements.
Por gostar muito de jogos Idle, sou suspeito para falar, porém, este é um idle muito bacana que possui muitas interações diferentes ao longo dos níveis que você vai conquistando, além de te dar um prêmio diário seguindo a página do Facebook.

Muito bacana pra matar tempo, possui um número razoável de achivements e ainda tem badge caso o player goste (precisa comprar)

review: Dette er måske et af de bedste og mest kreative idle games jeg har prøvet og jeg har prøvet en stor del efterhånden. der er så mange spændene dele hvor man skal skifte og opgradere forskellige dele uden at det bliver kedeligt eller for advanceret. det kan dog tage lang tide før man virkelig kommer op i grader men det gør slet ikke spor. det er jo en af pointernen  med denne slags games at man ikke bare skal blive færdig med det i løbet at 3 dage. men det bliver på ingen måde kedeligt. de finder hele tiden på noget nyt og spændene og som har sammenhæng med det hele. det får  6 stjerner af mig ******

review: It's fairly well produced, but it's so painfully slow to get going that even after several days half the buttons in the navigation pane are disabled and locked behind levels that I can only assume will take months or years to reach.  If you play idle and incremental games for the joy of discovery, this might frustrate you and you'll see everything there is to see in the first hour that's not locked away behind months of repetition and waiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093355799', 'num_games_owned': 5830, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1536959598}
review:
Holyday City Reloaded is an idle, clicker city game.
It reminds me a lot of the game AdVenture Capitalist which i have played for many hours.
Games like this are addictive and very time consuming.
You basically just click from time to time too collect money and invest it in something else to make more money.
And I know... While writing this I realize how boring that may sound.

However, this game tries to be creative with more upgrades, events and boosts.
I like that the game has a lot of variation where you not only just collect money but also resources to unlock other boosts/upgrades.

It's free, It's a good time killer, You can play it while doing other things on your PC and you can even play it offline.
So far it's a great idler game and since it's early access i look forward to what they have in store for us in the future.

review: 遊戲屬於「放置經營」類型，收稅(轉生)的節奏其實控制得還算不錯，透過轉生所獲得的錢，聘請員工(Buff)之後，原本稍微卡時間的進度，就會比較容易推進，不過要玩到城市升級效果才會越來越明顯，不同階段的發展，會發現主力建築的配置不同，這點是和其他同一條直線放置經營玩法最大的差異，推薦給喜歡放置，又有一點變化性的朋友玩看看。

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 13554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1569676066}
review:
Not Early Access Review (27.09.2019):
Holiday City Reloaded is the nice-looking idle/clicker game, very similar to the Adventure Capitalist. You build a city and then an island-resort, there are many various resources to collect, activities to click through, as so on. Plus, I repeat, nice cartoon visuals and even looped music theme is not that bad... for 5 or 10 minutes, maybe.

But yes, I'm (still) definitely Not Recommend it. Why? Well, it's the numbers. They always seem to like messing up all over. And messing you, player, in the first place.

There is one system failure. The greater the numbers in the game are, the less correct they are calculated. Which is especially notable when you use some "enhancers", which you need to buy with "Gold", and "Gold", as usual in "f-2-p", you're buying with your dollar. Those "enhancers", even the biggest, like "fasten time in the game for two weeks", only fasten it by one, two, maybe 5 in-game minutes. Broken math, I'd call it. Same goes for achievements. 24-h achievements I get after 25 hours online, ok. But 144-h achievement - after 170 hours! And I bet that the last, "200-h" achievements will be after 250-h+ online, which is really cumbersome. Not cool.

So. Please, don't try it. There is nothing really special about this clicker which you can't see in AdvCapitalist, or maybe some more of similar games, where the numbers are more correct.

review:
Just another fun clicker game.

I do enjoy it however am getting extremely frustrated trying to get the prestige item - tickets to "play" are too expensive as the chance of one of the letters even being in a box at all seems extremely low (ie the last 20 tickets at least that Ive used, there was no letter to even have a chance to get)

Outside of this its ok but I see myself getting over it pretty quickly (and have spent real money in the game including the monthly subscription so I'm not just expecting everything for free. 

Takes too long for the towns to level up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014913462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1514788465}
review:
A fun game, I will play a run until city level 2, it will take me 4 hours or so, then the game is pretty much tapped out. Not bad for free.

EDIT It should have been a quick jaunt to town level 2 but they put some bizzaire logarithmic equations in there to throttle progress. Checking further in the discussions they have MANY anti progress and ANTI FUN ideas in this "game" such as town level resetting with every restart. Review changed to negative - war waged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800121814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1514854631}
review:
i'm definitely a fan, and I've played too many "casual idle clicker" games to count. i like to call them "hurry up and wait" games, but this is keeping my interest and i like it enough to actually write a review. :)
cute and well-organized. definitely enough expansion to keep your interest for quite a bit -- not only the events with their individual exclusive rewards, but multiple currencies so you need to expand different places to buy different items or upgrades or whatever else there is to buy.

if you like idle clickers, i would definitely recommend it. it reminds me a lot of AdVenture Capitalist on iPhone, but with more complexities. Not perfect and not exactly amazing graphics, but it's good.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198295429564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 14338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13342, 'last_played': 1534913914}
review:
I have played their original Holyday City on Kongregate before.
I think it was one of the first idle games I have played years ago.
I think I can trust them on this too.

It's similar to AdVenture Capitalist in many ways, that is to say; basics for idle games.
Also, the game may appears to want you in microtransaction really bad, but the game is long-term, and it gives you all the stuffs you need. Eventually, you will reach end-game just fine, and to be honest, once a certain point is reached, even IAP will worth only a few days of free daily prizes.

The game is idle-dominant (meaning you spend much more time waiting on stuffs than on doing something)
and it gives you some things to think about; things like investment plan, when and what to do something.
Invest on the wrong thing or at the wrong time, and you'll waste a lot of time for minimal gain.
So the game gives you all the info, and you take the time factor and calculate them yoursef, what is for the best.

Due to that part of using info, beginers may have a hard time on this, because they don't know what an idle game can offer, but it's alright as they'll learn quickly and adapt to new features without problem.

Pretty long game, but you can actually see the goal that is not infinity.
They'll probably still improve or add more things but great Idle game, so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968744134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1601470532}
review:
This is a fun and addicting game. 

I used to play this game on the web, but finally it has been released on Steam (which is my prefered gaming platform).

In this game you generate money that help you build more buildings/businesses. There are also many other resources like food and materials that help you upgrade. As you level up your city many new sections will be unlocked like the Port. Except from the main game there are various events that give you many bonuses.

It has great graphics and amazing developer support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368169348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1513592087}
review:
Fun and addictive Idle/clicker game which has lots of updates and events through the year. I v been enjoying this game for more than two months on kongregate

I also  recommend you  play Midas Gold Plus. the other holyday studio game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198335808107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1513556324}

author: {'steamid': '76561198418862153', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1521501513}
review:
Love this game as much as I do Midas Gold Plus, the game is not merely an idle clicker but has depth, goals, things to actually achieve! If you like Adventure Capitalist, you are REALLY going to love this game... 

Unlike other idle clickers it is also not pay to win, yes there are options to pay but you can do it without paying as they give you gold and rewards daily just for logging in. Win/Win!

Like it so much I even subscribed!

review: Interesting and good free economy game of time. You buy first bulding, wait and gather cash, buy more buildings, gather even more cash and buy even more and better buildings. You buy fabric and power station, and farm to gather resourcers to upgrade buildings. You level up your town, what gets plenty of time. You wait, buy, upgrade and more wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294278917', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1524703789}
review: great game tons of fun to be had with this one. Its nice and refreshing to find a idle game thats not full of microtranscations. Dont get me wrong there are some in this game but they are totally resonable. big thunbs up to the devs always giving out premium items ( microtransaction stuff ) on the twitter and facebook page. I cant wait to see what they will do next with this epic timewaster!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6897, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1656966238}
review:
Постройте город и станьте настоящим магнатом! Вам потребуется всего несколько нажатий и терпение! В Холидэй-Сити вы управляете ресурсами и предприятиями. Ваша цель — сделать из городка огромный мегаполис.

В этом кликере ваш город растет и развивается в фоновом режиме. Механика игры позволяет открывать предприятия и управлять ими простым нажатием. Процветание города — вопрос времени и управления ресурсами.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969491040', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1532890143}
review:
Another solid Idle game from Holyday Studios.  
Build your city, level your buildings, work towards the atomic lab, the port, the marina and the airport.
Is a long game with months of content from the get go and being actively updated now.
Also features various events throughout the year

A big plus with this game is there is no penalty for being offline for a while. Check in for your daily rewards (and later on quests at the marina) and you'll progress well while you work / sleep.

Well worth a go
